website_summaries.verdict: Canon's Pixma MP990 should appeal to photo types wanting good quality, but they'll need a little patience to go along with it.
cons: Installs a tonne of add-on packages
Weird print pauses make print speeds even slower

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I have only had the printer a few days so my experience with it is limited, but I have to say that so far I am very impressed. The footprint is a little large, but it has weight and feels like quality construction. I was a little intimidated when I started the set-up, but the instructions walk you through it step-by-step and I had no problems. I mostly dreaded trying to set up the wireless networking; they offer you more than one set-up option, but I followed the directions for copying the network settings from Windows Vista onto a USB drive and it worked like a charm! The printing is fast and quiet and I love the automatic duplex printing.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen R

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, but guzzles ink!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a Canon PIXMA iP4000 printer, because its printhead failed. Also wanted scanning capability. This has a great scanner, great print quality, and prints faster, with a LITTLE less initial grinding and thinking than my last Canon printer, but, wow, it GUZZLES ink. We are LIGHT users, and it's drained all but one ink tank in 2 months! Despite Canon warnings, I'm planning on using compatible ink cartridges after the warranty period is over. I just can't afford $50 in ink every 2 months. Canon, take heed: this will be my last Canon printer unless you fix this problem!
customer_reviews.author: T. Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: ** Pick another model **
customer_reviews.text: Warning: beware the Amber light!!! This printer is not worth the risk. It worked under a dozen times over an eight month span. The spot that it occupied was well ventilated, and it was never bothered. I powered it down, unplugged the power cord, and it never turned back on. Google search turned up that this model is effectively defective, and that the Amber light is a known issue. I'd advise you to look at updated models, or another brand, especially if you do not have readily available back-up printer options (i.e. work printing, or very cool neighbors).
customer_reviews.author: David de Alva

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic InkJet Printer
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for about a year now. I absolutely love it. The ink doesn't run out as quick as other inkjet printers I've owned. The WiFi feature is really nice and easy to set up. It just power up from sleep mode and opens the tray when you send a print job. No need to go in and turn the printer on. Photos print beautifully on it. My only disappointment was that I didn't read close enough and the Bluetooth printing feature requires an "optional Canon Bluetooth Unit BU-30." It would be nice to print photos directly from my phone.
customer_reviews.author: JA KlingTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: All Told, Things Worked Out
customer_reviews.text: The first printer that arrived had a major problem that could not be fixed. Support had us box it up and return it for a second unit. Next one that came (and quite fast) was just fine. Convenient support for setup that would work with MAC OSX 10.6, Snow Leopard, had not been accomplished yet so the setup was a nightmare. I believe that has now been completed and the setup would just be installing the one file instead of the various that we had to do. That said, the printer returns beautiful photographs and works just great.
customer_reviews.author: cgilbert

customer_reviews.title: Canon Wireless
customer_reviews.text: The printer works well. The controls are a little difficult to get used to when trying to make a copy. Scanner works well. Print quality is good. Duplexing is a very nice feature. Haven't printed much graphics but what I have looks good. Don't know how long the ink csrtridges will last, so I can't comment on how economical it is to use. I have scanned documents but not slides or negatives which is on my list of things to check out on this printer. The wireless feature will come in handy when I load the drivers on other computers. Overall I am satisfied with this printer
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gendron

customer_reviews.title: After 1 year - still a great printer
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for over a year now (7/28/2009) and it's still working like a champ. Even with my wife's scrap booking, birthday cards, photos, wedding invitations and thank you cards(300 people), we still only used up 2 sets of ink cartridges. For ink I used non-OEM ink cartridges. I don't notice any quality difference between them and the OEM and I never had any blockage. I bought 14 cartridges (2 sets) for only $70 with free shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Loving_Parents_baby_and_Pugs

customer_reviews.title: PIXMA MP990
customer_reviews.text: This printer was one of the first wireless ones available,so that was a big selling point to me....to be able to print documents or photos from my laptop without being right next to it. I wanted the best photo quality I could get-I wouldn't say they are professional quality, but they do print nice photos with some interesting options for sizes-like scanning to wallet size, 5 x 7, up to 8 x 10. The ink does seem to run out quickly as it has 6 tanks to keep filled and that was getting expensive, but then I started buying generic refills cheap on Amazon and it's been much better.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Bosela

customer_reviews.title: How much ink does a printer need??
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for about 2 years now. I don't use it very often, maybe 2-3x every other month, and am SHOCKED that I have had to replace the black ink 4 times already. I like the quality, and it's easy to use, but man alive this thing burns through ink like crazy. I found some non-OEM ink cheap luckily because the canon cartridges are about $12 a piece and I really don't understand why this printer needs ~$50 worth of ink a year when I print maybe a dozen pages during that time. If replacing ink doesn't bother you, then this is the printer of your dreams. Otherwise, you might want to keep shopping.
customer_reviews.author: BeeSays

customer_reviews.title: Good Printer
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought I'd bought cheap. The printer seemed really slow and it is made out of cheap plastic. The paper tray doesn't slide in and out easily and it's tricky to attach it when you put more paper in. However after the first use the speed issue went away - it now prints very quickly and the wireless factor is really cool. Set-up was as easy as setting up printers gets. It prints well & cleanly, though it seems to be drinking ink pretty quickly. It scans quickly and I bought it for the film/slide scanning capability which is great and not common. Overall a great buy at the price and I'm very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R. Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Complete Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Why it's a POS: It takes approximately 10min from the time you turn it on until it actually starts printing. So much for the "quick operation" feature. Ink lasts about half as long as my old iP3000. It also uses chipped ink cartridges. Yay for anti-competitive business practices. The drivers/software look like they were built for Windows 3.1 The WiFi is flaky at best. You can only use the scanner with a USB connection. And last but not least - the heads on mine are 99% clogged, even though it got used daily and goes through that 10min cleaning cycle at startup. So basically I have a $300 printer that can produce barley legible (monochrome) text.
customer_reviews.author: Gir

customer_reviews.title: Love This Printer!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I did quite a bit of research and read lots of reviews before deciding to purchase this printer. I chose it for its outstanding reviews and for its high quality scanning feature. I have not been dissappointed! It's photo scanning quality makes the photo look like it came straight off my digital camera. Amazing!!! When printing it does take a little longer than my old printer but it is quiter and better quality. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: bakerash

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: I origionally ordered this for my Mom but she didn't like it because it eats through ink cartridges like a 4 year old through crayons so she gave it to me. I does exactly that, put in a new tank of one color and almost immediately it is asking for a tank of another color. While the printer is fairly fast, I can't keep feeding it ink cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: dlary9890

customer_reviews.title: would not get again
customer_reviews.text: should be a network printer, it is not, everytime you want to use it on the network you have to reload the drivers on that computer, this printer is the worst I have ever seen
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Good scanner, works with XSane 0
customer_reviews.text: Good scanner, works with XSane 0.999 on FreeBSD. Canon's quick-start doesn't mention the included 35mm negative/slide scanning capability; I found out about it from a camera store employee 6 months after I bought the MP990. Slide/negative scanning is much easier using Canon's Windows tools. Kind of thirsty about ink; I think it uses some at each power-up, even if it's only used to scan items.
customer_reviews.author: james van bokkelen

customer_reviews.title: Good, But Not Great
customer_reviews.text: The print quality is good. However, the printer is very slow, and there is no expectation on the ink cartridges to last for the anticipated life of a cartridge. The replacement cartridges are over priced and do not last. Overall, the printer was OK but there are better printers to consider for the price.
customer_reviews.author: dar

customer_reviews.title: Canon MPl990 Multi Function Printer
customer_reviews.text: The Canon MP990 printer has been an excellent buy. It has met and exceeded all my expectations. Easy setup, and easy to use. I would recommend it to anyone. The only drawback is the lack of ability to buy the gray ink at a local store, ie, Staples, Office Depot etc. If one does buy the printer, I would recommend buying a couple of gray inks on line to have on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H. Merrill

customer_reviews.title: Great printer!
customer_reviews.text: This printer has been a great little printer! I wanted a printer I could use wirelessly and this does the job! Very easy to set up and no problem with it working. I do a lot of photo printing and the photo prints are beautiful.I'm very plased with the product so far. I did buy ink cartridges and the usage and price does not seem out of line with my previous printer (another brand).
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen e Baumiller

customer_reviews.title: Update to Lion
customer_reviews.text: I updated to Lion and the wifi "feature" no longer works ("A communication error has occurred"). Even before Lion the wifi was spotty. Canon software truly stinks. It is clunky and is hardly intuitive. I am a Mac user. Canon is clearly a PC company. I would not recommend this product or any other Canon product to a Mac user.
customer_reviews.author: intlpvti

customer_reviews.title: Replaced a Epson Printer RX550 I had for 7 years
customer_reviews.text: Would recommend, has the quality I was looking for and the size fits nicely in my desk drawer. My previous printer was RX550 which was really bulky. This printer set up for wireless a great, easily works with our personal computer along with my work computer without hard wire hook up. This product came quickly and price was also a great deal. Would recommend to anyone who is looking for picture printing quality along with ease of set up.
customer_reviews.author: B. Tewes

customer_reviews.title: Expensive Running
customer_reviews.text: This printer runs out of ink quite rapidly. Even if one of its 5 tanks are empty it will not allow you to do anything, printing scanning, anything till you buy that tank. In my opinion it is way to rip off. At least it should allow me to scan. I realized today when I needed an urgent scanning and grey ink was finished and thats it. Printer is just locked off, keeps giving an error of ink is ran out and does not allow to do anything. Build up is also cheap. Door and covers stop working properly after couple of months use.
customer_reviews.author: A Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA MP990
customer_reviews.text: I recently received my new printer. It was easy to set-up, instructions were clear and simple and the printer works very well. I particularly like the wireless feature. Thus far I have only printed narrative and no photo's which is why I only gave it a 4 star for print quality and economy.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: a little slow
customer_reviews.text: everything works fine setup was easy enough but my mom or wife would not be able to set up (not the most computer savy) copying was pretty slow alot of time for printer to get ready to print then a hesitation (5 seconds) in the middle of each page Photos were good as I expected and I expect alot from Canon. Wireless works without a hitch although a little time was invested getting everything talking to each other. Ink tanks already look like they'll run out fast, but I'm used to that. The price you pay for conveniance and ability to touch up and create special photos. Overall what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: D. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: A great printer if you have limitless funds to use to ...
customer_reviews.text: The "I can do everything, including make ink disappear while I am just sitting here" printer. A great printer if you have limitless funds to use to buy ink.
customer_reviews.author: EQUUS

customer_reviews.title: Great for photos
customer_reviews.text: If anyone else is selling this printer at a reasonable price, I will buy it. A great printer and I promise you will not be disappointed! Prints photos professionally quality like!!! The software program you will love it! Canon, please don't stop making this printer!
customer_reviews.author: ChuckVegas

customer_reviews.title: Short Product Review
customer_reviews.text: Printer does everything I need it to do and scans in paper photos very well without much distortion once I open them. It works well on the first floor with my wireless signal from the third floor of my 1832 home. It communicates flawlessly with my 2006 Apple Macbook. Set up was a little weird, but it worked out. I recommend this printer. Look for it on sale around Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Bilsky

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer few years back it is still working fine
customer_reviews.author: Roc Pat

customer_reviews.title: Serious design flaw
customer_reviews.text: This printer has a design feature, perhaps intentional, that makes it stop working when one of your color cartridges runs one, even when you try to pring B@W image setting option to grayscale and black cartridge being full.
customer_reviews.author: ronny111

customer_reviews.title: Ink Guzzler
customer_reviews.text: Great print quality and speed, but the ink use is the worst I've seen. I'm not new to Canon or HP printers, and this needs a refill constantly on light use. I hesitate to print jobs at home, finding myself taking them to work to print. The cartridges are expensive, too ($12-15 a piece, and it requires 5 colors. So here I sit, needing to print forms to transfer my 403b account, but can't print because I'm out of gray, but I'm printing in black and white!
customer_reviews.author: Thos

customer_reviews.title: Worthless Ink Hog
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened. Scanner is merely adequate. Photos scanned do not have near the quality of my previous Kodak printer and Epson standalone scanner. Eats ink EVERY time I try to print. Just waiting for it to finish its drink so I can get a print copy is irritating. Called Canon and was told it is the nature of the beast. Save your money. Buy a REAL scanner and a Brother laser printer. Take your photos to the drug store. I will NEVER buy another inkjet.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Wise

customer_reviews.title: Canon MP990 Review
customer_reviews.text: The printer is great all the way around. Scanner is easy to use and you can save the scans as a pdf so it easily attaches to emails. The only issue is that the ink does not last too long and at $13 bucks a cartridge it can cost you some $ but thats with most printers. Basically after printing 30 photos 8X10's one ink color is done! For the $130 price I paid nothing else I saw out there comes close!
customer_reviews.author: Peter J. Schreyer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Service
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great printer. Scanned lots of old slides. Have had it for years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This Canon Pixma does not dissapoint!
customer_reviews.text: Double-sided printing, great quality for regular printing and photos, bluetooth connection for both our computers, loads of extra features ~ I've been wanting and researching great printers for a while, and am so happy to have this awesome printer, especially with the $100 rebate from Canon through Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: DotTriOtt

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, good with photos.
customer_reviews.text: Great printer which has lasted me several years so far. Never anything wrong with it and does an excellent job of printing photos. Very realistic colors.
customer_reviews.author: D. E. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Prints crisply, quietly, and rapidly
customer_reviews.text: Great item. Had my initial reservations of getting the "right" printer. In the end, this printer indeed was and is the best I've had to date. Cheap, quiet and crisp in its photo and text printouts. I'd buy again without any reservations.
customer_reviews.author: Ron P

customer_reviews.title: certainly not a quick set-up
customer_reviews.text: I just received my order today & it has taken me 45 minutes to remove it from the excessive wrapping, reading the 50 page "read me first" manual, aligning the print head, etc. Seriously, 45 minutes. And I'm no luddite living in a cave. This is by far the most time-consuming set-up of any electronic equipment I've ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: sara

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: The printer works well, don't know that I would recommend this for pictures. I contacted support on the picture quality, but they weren't real helpful. It works for the scanning and printing portion, do not recommend for Photo Printing.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Canono wireless printer
customer_reviews.text: The printer was easy to set up and does excellently what I bought it for. A bit noisy and a bit slow but does a very good job and the print is very, very good. I use it for a PC, a Mac and Ubuntu. Works without a hitch.
customer_reviews.author: Tilo J. Haas

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as Epson Artisan 810
customer_reviews.text: Puchased and subsequently returned the Canon Pixma MP 990 when we found it did not print photos as well as the years-old HP 8450 we were retiring. Insufficient detail and inadequate color gamut were the core issues. Bought an Epson Artisan 810, and while a bit flimsy in certain areas, the print quality and speed were astounding. Epson Software is fine and works flawleslly with Windows 7.
customer_reviews.author: Horserancher

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: My biggest concern was to find a printer that was good for photos, had a scanner and allowed me to use recycled/refillable cartridges. This was not the case with the EPSON, so I went with the Canon. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: WOW WHAT A DEAL! AIO CANON PIXMA MP990 WIRELESS INKJET
customer_reviews.text: Thought it was a great LIGHTNING DEAL at $105 but that was an understatement! This printer(AIO CANON PIXMA MP990 WIRELESS) is sooo easy to set up on a network! Great picture print! Included software is Sooo cool! What a delight to have a product work right out of the box - the way it was meant to be!
customer_reviews.author: Bee Bo

customer_reviews.title: The best so far . . .
customer_reviews.text: After MUCH reviw of the multi-printers available, I went with is MP990. It has lived up to my expectations. One area I would like to see improvement in is the ability for the printer to have an auto-feed for document and photo copies - although this would warrant a higher price for the additional mechanisms. Everything comes out excellent, from printed documents off the computer, photo reproductions, photo reproductions from slides, et. al. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. M. Tarailo

customer_reviews.title: ink is a problem
customer_reviews.text: If you use this printer infrequently, once or twice a week for one or two copies, ink becomes a major cost. it's ridiculous. Be aware, gray does not come in the color pack. I like the printer otherwise. love the wireless. Easy to use. good but not the best prints. this machine is no match for the ip8500 that finally died. making copies on this machine is a single button push.
customer_reviews.author: allen

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma MP990
customer_reviews.text: Uses lots of ink. Seems it likes to clean itself too often thus using excess ink
customer_reviews.author: doc

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA MP990 Wireless Inkjet Photo All-In-One Printer
customer_reviews.text: The printer was delivered quickly an was in perfect shape when it arrived. All the features perform as described. I had some trouble with the set-up (the set-up guide could be more user friendly in a couple of places) but nothing major that prevented me from using the device. It operates flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Marishiten

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA MP990 Wireless Inkjet Photo All-In-One Printer (3749B002)
customer_reviews.text: The cannon MP990 is a great printer. It scans and prints slides and negatives perfectly. The olny draw back I have found is the printed document can not be highlighted without smudging.
customer_reviews.author: stampingirl

customer_reviews.title: Get it! You will be pleased.
customer_reviews.text: This MP990 is a fantastic over-all printer. it performs well in all modes. The individual ink tanks are a plus.
customer_reviews.author: S. E. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: I was a former HP printer owner. After reading many Canon product reviews I made the switch myself and am SO happy! The quality is much better and it is more reliable. I had so many mechanical issues with HP over recent years so am relieved to have a great printer now. My only complaint is the initial wireless setup was a little confusing but have a technical friend who figured out my problem.
customer_reviews.author: ksukaye

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA MP990 - A Great All in One At A Great Price
customer_reviews.text: A really good all in one printer - copier - scanner at a great price. Great quality print for documents and photos. Excellent clarity for document and photo scans. Harder to set up wireless configuration than I was led to believe from Canon promo material as we had to download an up to date driver from the Canon website for Macbook Pro laptop.
customer_reviews.author: R. F. Carniaux

customer_reviews.title: Mp990  Almost  an excellent printer
customer_reviews.text: It's not bad but every time i turn it on or want to print another something all i hear is clicky clicky seems forever before it starts to print. Also the ink shows low before it really is low, I threw out a cartridge before I should have..when another cartridge show the ! I kept printing and it was a lot of printing done before the it was actually empty all in all it's not bad Gene
customer_reviews.author: Gene A Griffith

customer_reviews.title: MONEY WELL SPENT
customer_reviews.text: WAS EASY TO SET UP. IT MAY GO THROUGH ALOT OF INK BUT I DID SOME SHOPPING ONLINE AND FOUND INK AT A FRACTION OF THE COAST OF CANON INK. HAS WORKED PERFECT FOR 2-3 MONTHS NOW...I WOULD BUY THIS PRINTER AGAIN
customer_reviews.author: sayshaduke

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Printer
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with this one. How can they even make this for the price.
customer_reviews.author: TOBY

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: just got this after owning previous 4 year old model pixma all in one. the setup was a breeze for both our MACs and PCs. great print quality and love the full wireless connectivity for scanning and printing. prints quiet and fast enough. highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MilesColtrane

customer_reviews.title: Another victim of the Amber Light of Death
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer in Jan of 2010, and used it about 5 times a month. It suddenly failed in Feb of 2011. Upon powering up, the unit's amber trouble led lit up, and the unit would not function. The printer was then taken to a certified Canon repair specialist who informed me that the unit's control board was probably bad, but he could not guarantee that replacing it would fix the problem. He suggested that it would be cheaper to buy a new printer. After searching the web, it appears that this is a common failure. This printer is not reliable. Do not buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey R. Umstead

customer_reviews.title: A wireless wonder
customer_reviews.text: The Canon PIXMA 990 is an excellent low-cost, wireless all-in-one unit. It took some time to learn to use its save to computer function and as always with full-feature printers it takes time to be able to utilize all the functions, but once mastered this printer I was happy with every print. I matched it with the $1000 Microtek ScanWizard Pro and at the 300 dpi the quality was comparable and fast. When I got this all-in-one I was looking for 1) color printer, 2) true IEEE 802.11 a,b,g,n wifi, 3) large-format - although I didn't find a large-format I did get the Canon name which has always been good-quality to me.
customer_reviews.author: E. J. Spear

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does everything I need. Print B/W, color (great with photos), scan pictures, documents, roll film and slides.
customer_reviews.author: Terrence J. O'Leary

customer_reviews.title: weak Wi-Fi
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awesome! Two "speed-bumps" tho: 1-Doesn't always print to the edge, but leaves a slight border. 2-There's no external antenna provision for weak Wi-Fi areas. In some cases this results in very slow photographic printing
customer_reviews.author: Thump

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Set up was a breeze. This from a very non-technical person. Very satisfied with the quality of print and a few photos. Have used HP products for the last ten years and was unhappy with the last HP. Have told family and friends to take a look at this product.
customer_reviews.author: colorado mtn high

customer_reviews.title: Awesome all in one Printer
customer_reviews.text: I love our new printer. I love the ability to print on both sides. I also love the wireless capability so that we can print from anywhere in the house. The screen set up is also very easy to use and understandable.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: best product ever
customer_reviews.text: it does everything. it is a good fit for my family would recommend it to Anny body go canon? cheep on ink you. can find ink tanks on ebay for cheep
customer_reviews.author: james jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Superb pinter, wireless connection is not so easy
customer_reviews.text: This printer is superior to anything I've ever seen. The only issue is the wireless setup. It's not as easy as you might think. It took me an hour to figure out a way to connect.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Deniro

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Although setup involved a little reading everything went together as per instructions and everything is working properly. Wireless setup was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ottmar

customer_reviews.title: Great Home Printer!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up wired or wireless. Full of features. Great for photos. Best all-in-one for the home.
customer_reviews.author: potsie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I've printed 80 invitations with a grayscale pic on the outside and color inside - perfect! I've also printed 300+ notecards - again, perfect. Love this printer! Wireless setup was a breeze with Vista (nothing else is a breeze with Vista!) I've printed a few color photos, with better-than-average results. I am sooo happy I purchased this Pixma 990 printer!
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma MP990
customer_reviews.text: Superb scanning and photo printing. Wireless setup is not all that difficult and Canon's tech support is excellent in case you need them.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Bergen

customer_reviews.title: PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: I DO NOT LIKE THIS AT ALL. USES WAY TO MUCH INK JUST A MONEY SUCKER UPPER. I HATE WRITING THIS REVEIW WITH YOU MAKING ME WRITE NINETEEN WORDS. I HAVE BETTER THINGS TO DO.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Smith

customer_reviews.title: YAHOO!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer/scanner. Easy set up. Just turn it on and it tells where to go from there. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: PIXMA 990
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used enough to give rating on economy but I like most everything about the unit. Just a little slow to start up.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Professional printing at a consumer price.
customer_reviews.text: Anyone who says this printer doesn't print as good as professional print companies is doing something wrong. I compared prints from a company I order from and from this printer...NO difference! Color was great, quality was AWESOME! Ink might run out a little faster than my last printer but.. these cartridges aren't exactly big you know. I have printed about 10 or so 8X10...probably 2 dozen or more 4x6 and about 12 or so 5x7.. and I am still on my original ink cartridges. That doesn't even include all the regular printing I've done. Best investment I've made all year! Best printer I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.author: D. P. Murray

product_meta.title: Canon PIXMA MP990 Wireless Inkjet Photo All-In-One Printer (3749B002)
product_meta.description:
The PIXMA MP990 is the ultimate Wireless All-In-One Photo Printer. You'll experience peak performance once it's taken out of the box and hooked-up. This unmatched quality begins with a built-in Wi-Fi capability that lets you print wirelessly1 from anywhere around the house. You can also connect to a wired network if you choose via built-in Ethernet. Built-in Auto Duplex Printing helps you keep it green by automatically printing on both sides of the paper, which can help reduce your paper cost by 50%.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


The PIXMA MP990 is the ultimate Wireless All-In-One Photo Printer. You'll experience peak performance once it's taken out of the box and hooked-up. This unmatched quality begins with a built-in Wi-Fi capability that lets you print wirelessly1 from anywhere around the house. You can also connect to a wired network if you choose via built-in Ethernet. Built-in Auto Duplex Printing helps you keep it green by automatically printing on both sides of the paper, which can help reduce your paper cost by 50%.




Print from anywhere in the house quickly and easily!View largerThe PIXMA MP990 Wireless Inkjet Photo All-In-One touts a maximum resolution of 9600 x 24002 and boasts a six individual ink tank system that includes a photo black and gray ink for professional color and black & white photos. Its superior 4800 dpi3 high-resolution CCD scanner includes a Film Adapter Unit to easily scan 35mm film and slides. Plus, the White LED eliminates warm-up time for document and photo scanning. The PIXMA MP990's ease of use continues with a large 3.8" Color LCD, the Easy Scroll Wheel, Auto Photo Fix II, Auto Scan Mode4, Quick Start and computer-free printing through compatible USB Flash Drives5, Memory Cards6, IrDA7 , PictBridge and optional Bluetooth8 devices. All of this with a gorgeous borderless 4" x 6" photo that prints in approx. 20 seconds!9,10


Speed & Quality
Superior Resolution: Realize the power of 9600 x 2400 maximum color dpi firing with 1pl ink droplet size. Incredible quality and detail in both your photos and business documents.

Premium, Six Individual Ink System with Gray Ink: This 6-color ink system consists of five dye-based inks including a gray ink for unmatched Black & White photos. The pigment-based black ink also produces crisp, laser-quality text for documents. So, you only replace the color ink tank that runs out.

Fast 4" x 6" Printing: Print a borderless 4" x 6" in approx. 20 seconds! 

ChromaLife100+: This system combines enhanced FINE print head technology with select genuine Canon photo papers and inks for beautiful borderless photos that will last up to 300 years11 when stored in an archival-quality photo album. 

The stylish PIXMA MP990 will stand out anywhere in your home.View largerEase of Use
Built-In Auto Duplex Printing: Keep it green and print on both sides of the page without the hassle of turning it over manually. This can cut your paper usage by 50% so you save time, money and paper - plus you're helping the environment! 

Film Adapter Unit: This included unit makes it easy to scan 35mm film and slides so you can reprint your most cherished memories.

3.8" LCD Screen: Easily view, select and edit your images for simple computer-free printing. No downloading needed, just pick your pic and print!

Easy Scroll Wheel: Easily and quickly access and select the various features available for faster operation. 

Auto Photo Fix II: This built-in technology automatically categorizes your images into one of five types - Portrait, Scenery, Night Scenery, Snapshot with Scenery, and Snapshot with Night Scenery - then applies optimal image and multi-zone exposure correction. So, unexposed areas of the photo will be optimized, area by area and faces that are backlit and under-exposed will automatically be brightened with correct color cast to help ensure more accurate skin tones for gorgeous images. 

Auto Scan Mode: Automatically recognizes the type of original, then scans and saves the suitable settings.

Beautiful & Borderless: Print borderless12, photo lab quality up to 8.5" x 11"

2 Way Paper Feeding: This feature lets you load paper from the front cassette or rear tray so whether your printing on plain or photo paper, you’re ready to print! 

Quick Start: Powering up your printer is now faster than ever. After pressing the power button you can begin inputting commands in mere seconds. So, full operation is possible in a much shorter time. 

Dual Color Gamut Technology: Copy with confidence as this built-in technology automatically optimizes your copy quality based on the type of original you’re copying to help your copies stay true to it.

Print 2-sided to save paper!View larger Connectivity
Built-in Wireless: Be free of the wires that bind youªÓ Print and scan wirelessly from any Wi-Fi enabled computer while you're in another room.

Built-in Ethernet: This wired LAN interface lets you connect to a home or office network, with connected computers sharing the power of this versatile machine, each being able to display the printer's status at any moment. 

USB Flash Memory/Memory Cards / PictBridge/ IrDA & Optional Bluetooth: Don't feel like using a computer? No problem. Just insert your compatible memory card into the built-in card slot, select images on the LCD display, and print! Thanks to a PictBridge connection you can also print photos directly from your USB Flash Memory Drive, digital camera, DV camcorder or camera phone13. Plus, you can print from a Bluetooth-enabled device using the optional BU-30 wireless Bluetooth unit. 

USB 2.0 Hi-Speed: Plug the cable into your PC for a super-fast connection for your data transfers. 


Print directly from memory cards.View largerFeatures





What's in the Box?
PIXMA MP990 Wireless Inkjet Photo All-In-One Document Kit: Cross Sell Sheet, Getting Started, Important Information Sheet, Network Troubleshooting Guide, Safety Environment Information, Setup Software & User's Guide CD-ROM, Warranty Card Ink Tanks: PGI-220 Pigment Black, CLI-221 (Cyan/Magenta/Yellow/Black/Gray) Power Cord Print HeadSample Media (PP-201 4" x 6"/5 Sheets) 



Consumables



The MP990 is compatible with the following consumables: PGI-220BK, CLI-221C, CLI-221M, CLI-221Y, CLI-221BK, and CLI-221GY.View larger









Disclaimers
1. Wireless printing requires a working Ethernet network with wireless 802.11b/g capability. Wireless performance may vary based on terrain and distance between the printer and wireless network clients.

2. Resolution may vary based on printer driver setting. Color ink droplets can be placed with a horizontal pitch of 1/9600 inch at minimum.

3. Optical resolution is a measure of maximum hardware sampling resolution, based on ISO 14473 standard. 

4. For network users, Auto Scan Mode is only available when scanning at a computer using MP Navigator EX software and selecting the 1-click feature then save to PC.

5. USB flash memory with security enabled may not be used. Requires an extension cable if cannot be attached.

6. Compatible memory cards include SD™ Memory Card, SDHC™, MultiMediaCard® , MultiMediaCard® Plus , CompactFlash® Card, Microdrive®, Memory Stick®, Memory Stick PRO™, Memory Stick Duo™ and Memory Stick PRO Duo™. The following can be used with the addition of a special adapter sold separately: miniSD™ Card, miniSDHCTM, microSD™ Card, microSDHC™, RS-MMC™ , Memory Stick Micro, xD-Picture Card®, xD-Picture Card® (Type M), and xD-Picture Card® (Type H).

7. Requires mobile phone or other device with IrDA port positioned no more than 7.9 inches from the printer.

8. Requires mobile phone (or other device) equipped with Bluetooth v2.0 technology and optional Canon Bluetooth Unit BU-30. Bluetooth operation depends on the device and software version used. Operating distance is approx. 10 meters but may vary due to obstacles, radio signals, locations where radio interference occurs, magnetic fields from microwave ovens, device sensitivity and/or antenna performance.

9. ISO/IEC 24734, 24735 define the default print and copy speed measurement methods. Print speeds are the averages of ESAT in Office Category Test for the default simplex mode, ISO/IEC 24734, excluding time to print the first set. Copy speed is the average of FCOT, ISO/IEC 24735 Annex D. ADF copy speed is the average of ESAT in General Performance Test for the default simplex mode, ISO/IEC 24735, excluding time to copy the first set. See our www.usa.canon.com/ipm for additional details.

10. Print speed measured as soon as first page begins to feed into printer. Copy speed is measured after the first page is ejected. Output speed will vary depending upon a number of factors. See www.usa.canon.com/printspeed for additional details.

11. Based on accelerated testing by Canon in dark storage under controlled temperature, humidity and gas conditions, simulating storage in an album with plastic sleeves. Canon cannot guarantee the longevity of prints; results may vary depending on printed image, drying time, display/storage conditions, and environmental factors. See www.usa.canon.com/chromalife100plus for additional details.

12. Supported paper types for borderless printing are as follows: Photo Paper Pro Platinum, Photo Paper Pro II, Photo Paper Plus Glossy II, Photo Paper Plus Semi-gloss, Photo Paper Glossy and Matte Photo Paper.

13. Requires mobile phone equipped with PictBridge technology and a USB cable.
